name: pork_tonkatsu
instructions: Season the pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides.
Dredge each pork chop in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and finally coat with panko breadcrumbs, pressing the crumbs onto the pork to adhere.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the pork chops until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.

In a bowl, mix the shredded cabbage, carrot, and green onion. In a separate small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sriracha, rice vinegar, salt, and sugar. Pour over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat.
For the tonkatsu sauce, mix ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, mirin (or sugar), and Dijon mustard in a small bowl until well combined.
Serve the pork tonkatsu with the spicy cabbage slaw on the side and drizzle with tonkatsu sauce or serve it on the side for dipping.
notes: For extra crispiness, press the breadcrumbs onto the pork chops after coating. Serve with steamed rice for a complete meal.
